G. the son who has B blood type

H. The son with AB blood type

I. The daughter with B blood type

J. The child with a rare blood type not listed

But according to the scenario, there's a daughter with A, which is A antigen only. So in this case, the child with A would have genotype IAIA, meaning the father must be IBIB because IA comes from the mother. Wait, no, the mother is ii, so she contributes i. Among the options, D is "the daughter who has blood group A," which fits this scenario. So the adopted child is D.

The correct answer is D
